Dear Greg Miles Toutant:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
9/12/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
• (1) An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
• (e) Three dated references which are
obtained prior to employment from
2

persons unrelated to the employee and
which are less than 12 months old.
Two of seven new employee files reviewed lacked three dated references
obtained prior to employment that are less than 12 months old. One of the two
new employee files reviewed was a rehire of a staff whose references were
obtained over 12 months prior to rehire. The second new employee file had one
reference that was received after the employee was hired.
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
• (1)An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
• (i) Documentation from the Michigan
department of human services, the
equivalent state or Canadian provincial
agency, or equivalent agency in the
country where the person usually resides,
that the person has not been determined
to be a perpetrator of child abuse or child
neglect. The documentation shall be
completed not more than 30 days prior to
the start of employment and every 12
months thereafter.
Two of seven new employee files reviewed lacked central registry clearances per
the rule. One of the new employees file showed central registry clearance was
obtained over 30 day prior to hire. One of the new employee files reviewed was a
rehire of the employee and new central registry clearance from outside Michigan
still had not been received.
CCI Rule 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
• (2) The licensee shall provide a written plan of
ongoing staff training related to individual job
functions and the institution’s program.
The facility does not have a training plan for the Music Program Facilitator job
function indicating ongoing staff training needed annually.
3

CCI Rule 400.4116 Chief administrator; responsibilities.
• (1) An agency shall assign the chief administrator
responsibility for the onsite day-to-day operation
of the institution and for ensuring compliance with
these rules.
Chief Administrator did not follow licensing rule to ensure central registry
clearance was obtained prior to employment for one employee. Chief
Administrator acknowledged knowing the central registry clearance was not
received back regarding clearances in Illinois and allowed the employee to start
working indicating the facility would take the licensing rule violation as a result of
not following the process and licensing rule.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical assistance on Rule 400.4155 (2) to include if the parent, staff, or
referral source are not involved in the initial treatment plan to indicate why as the
substance abuse program has HIPPA requirements and the youth has to allow for
who participates in the treatment planning.
• Technical assistance on Rule 400.4156 (2) to include if the parent, staff, or
referral source are not involved in the updated treatment plan to indicate why as
the substance abuse program has HIPPA requirements and the youth has to
allow for who participates in the treatment planning.
• Technical assistance on Rule 400.4146(4) as the facility recently had a youth
placed that is not current on one immunization and the parent signed indicating
they do not want the child to receive immunizations while at the facility. Discussed
the facility needing to have written statement that the parent objects on religious
grounds.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The facility update job description for the Music Program Facilitator as the facility
has direct care roles and responsibilities listed in the job description however
reported that is no longer accurate as the Music Program Facilitator no longer has
any direct care worker responsibilities.
• The facility is working to address a kitchen drain issue. Provided consultation on
what does and does not require plan reviews. The facility will continue to update
consultant on the status of the drain/plumbing issue.
• Recommended Rule 400.4166 Discharge Summaries obtain all the required
information on one report as currently the rule requirements are being captured
within three separate discharge documents.
4

• Discharge summaries be signed and dated by staff completing the discharge
summary and supervisor reviewing.
• The facility is experiencing difficulties in obtaining dental appointments in the
area. Provided consultation on looking outside the area, documenting all efforts to
schedule dental appointments, obtaining dental records prior to intake if a dental
was completed within the last fourteen months. Discussed utilizing a variance in
specific cases if needed.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on a review of the annual financial
report from Fiscal year 10/1/2021-9/30/2022. The facility has not received the
10/1/2022-9/30/2023 audit as of date. The facilities fiscal year 2024 budget was
reviewed compared to fiscal year 2023 and no concerns noted. Review of the
facilities submitted 990’s were reviewed and no concerns noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was reviewed. Chief Administrator reported
the facility has not had any corrective action plans or findings of rule violations
within the last year. Chief Administrator reported no barriers and indicated the
agency continues to monitor and implement the necessary changes in order to
maintain compliance with PA 116, and licensing rules.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection. Staff reported feeling very
supported by leadership and coworkers. Staff reported feeling safe and no
immediate concerns with the facility. The facility is currently low staffed and has
been working to hire and retain staff.
5

Youth interviews were conducted during the inspection. Youth reported feeling
safe and supported by staff at the facility. Youth reported the food at the facility
being very good and all their needs being met.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of the facility was completed during the onsite visit and no safety
concerns were noted. The facility currently is addressing a plumbing issue in the
kitchen. Medications and cleaning supplies were stored appropriately. All bedrooms
had appropriate bedding.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
